name: 12-hydroxy-3-oxocholan-24-oic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1772

name: 12-hydroxy-3-oxocholan-24-oic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1772
Reason: The structure of 12-hydroxy-3-oxocholan-24-oic acid comprises of several functional groups that influence its melting point: - The steroid backbone provides a rigid structure with a high degree of molecular complexity, which typically would increase the melting point significantly due to strong intermolecular forces. - The hydroxy (-OH) group forms hydrogen bonds, which tend to raise the melting point substantially. - The keto group (=O) as part of the 3-oxo moiety also contributes to stronger intermolecular forces such as dipole-dipole interactions, leading to an increase in the melting point. - The carboxylic acid (-COOH) group can form strong hydrogen bonds and dimerize, which would further drastically increase the melting point. - However, due to steric hindrance within the molecule, these effects might be partially offset, preventing the molecule from packing efficiently in the solid state, which would lower the melting point somewhat. It's also important to note that the compound has multiple chiral centers and a large, complex structure, which would generally be associated with a higher melting point because of the difficulty to arrange in a crystal lattice. Predicting exact quantitative values for each group's contributions in such a complex molecule is non-trivial, but the collective impact of the functional groups can be analyzed qualitatively. Based on the factors above, the prediction should likely be well over 100 degrees Celsius.
